We needed a place to stay medium term and Adam’s little place was perfect.
The kitchen is fully equipped with fridge/freezer, microwave, oven, sink and counter tops. The bathroom has a shower with multiple settings and good pressure, a toilet and a sink. It also has fast wifi, a Roku and a comfortable bed.
Autumn at Adam’s place was gorgeous, the two big trees in front of the place had beautiful autumnal colouration through October and November.
Adam was very accommodating while checking in, allowing us to check in early and move in for the stay. Throughout our stay he checked on us and washed the linens weekly on our terms, while being respectful our privacy.
The neighbours were very friendly and quiet.
In terms of walkability there is a pals, food city and gym across the road. Downtown is a 20 minute walk and the mall is a 30 minute walk.
We really enjoyed our stay and we highly recommend it to others.
Hugo and Alyssa

review_text: Best of everything - quiet, laid back lake living in a small community of homes with sweet neighbors. Very family friendly stay. Close proximity to major routes gets you to quaint downtown Morristown in 20 minutes and Knoxville or Pigeon Forge in around an hour. Plenty of local history within a half hour. We swam nightly off the dock and enjoyed beautiful sunsets. Bring crocs or water shoes as the ground is rocky and the lake level rises spring and summer and goes down in fall and winter. review_text:
We love the location and accommodations of John's bungalow. It sits far back from the road with a generous amount of grassy lawn on both the front and back sides of the home. Our kids loved the freedom it allowed to run around where the house sits a very safe distance from the waterfront. The property slopes gently as you walk down to the lake. The TVA lowers the water in the winter months providing plenty of rocky beach area for kids to play and explore as well.
We enjoyed lots of pink and purple sunsets over the lake from the comfort of the couch inside the picture window and often from the rocking chairs on the covered porch even in the winter.
The covered porch, abundance of blankets on hand, crock pot, fire pit and open concept between the kitchen and living room were some of our favorite features.
John is an accommodating and super responsive host. We'd be glad to book his place again.
15 minutes to the mall, movie theater, Ross, Walmart SuperCenter, etc.
9 minutes to Holt's IGA or 12 minutes to the Walmart Neighborhood Market for groceries
10 minutes to Cherokee Park (playground and splash pad)
The G H Coffman Country store (inexpensive, homemade breakfast and lunch Thurs-Sat and old-fashioned candy) down the road and the Red Barn Produce (tons of jams and spreads and some Amish made products) in Rutledge about 10 minutes away are some of our favorite local small businesses.

This cabin was just as described. However, the pictures don't really do it justice. The hill is steep, however fairly easy to manage, and we do appreciate the heads up! The cabin temp was perfect, and each room had an additional fan if needed. The cabin was clean. The kitchen was fully equipped, all we needed was our own food. The game room was perfect for the two 15 year old boys we had with us.
The beach is very private. I was a little concerned about having the neighbors so close, however, we seldom saw them, and we pretty much had the lake to ourselves. Boat traffic was very minimal. Visiting around was pretty easy as well. Traveling around was easy as well, your location wasn't too far away from the more popular areas. All in all, a great vacation spot and highly recommend this cabin and will definitely consider coming back!
